noun.description: (especially in former times) a person who travels from place to place mending metal utensils as a way of making a living.
An act of attempting to repair something.

verb.description: Attempt to repair or improve something in a casual or desultory way, often to no useful effect.
examples: he spent hours tinkering with the car

phrases: I don't give a tinker's damn what the hell you think in this case.
They never gave a tinker's cuss about the real issue of the mental hospital.
His expression bleak, he continued, I frankly don't give a tinker's curse about that end of it.'
I'm no accident - and I don't give a tinker's damn what you think.
I don't give a tinker's damn whether we withdraw unilaterally or multilaterally.
origin: Middle English (first recorded in Anglo-Latin as a surname): of unknown origin.
